ht32.category.l_trans.desc: I have discovered a method to transmute various materials into other materials by allowing lightning to strike a botanist's alchemy catalyst. Theoretically this could be done without waiting for nature's whims through some sort of $(l:patterns/great_spells/weather_manip)great spell./$
ht32.origin.axolane.desc: A biomechanical creature, part axolotl, part plane; familiar with the waters and the skies.
ht32.origin.bumblekin.desc: A buzzy little creature, friend of the various beehives and beenests of the world.
ht32.origin.lich.desc: A strange being made and sustained by the consumption of media.
ht32.origin.mobile_mind.desc: This mind is not bound to a single body, instead they may craft new ones and swap between them as they please.
ht32.origin.reality_engine.desc: The Reality Engine is a piece of technology that has been embedded within this being. This has caused the being to gain some minor control over the Reality Engine; with detriments to their physical body and their dimensional displacement.
ht32.power.ambystomic.desc: You can breath in water, and kills remove debuffs from nearby players while healing them.
ht32.power.barbed_stinger.desc: You apply poison when directly attacking but also take one and a half hearts of damage.
ht32.power.bionic.desc: You regenerate rapidly naturally, but other recovery methods are far less effective.
ht32.power.body_builder.desc: You can build more bodies for yourself. Apply a player head on a target dummy in your inventory to create a new body.
ht32.power.breathless_glide.desc: You can glide with your wings!
ht32.power.destabilizing.desc: Attacking an entity can cause the Reality Engine to alter spacetime around that entity randomly.
ht32.power.dimension_shadow.desc: This being's odd nature causes their presence to be broadcasted to all nearby dimensions.
ht32.power.emergency_swap.desc: Upon taking fatal damage you will swap to another body, and the previous will be destroyed. If there is no body to swap to, you die.
ht32.power.hively_home.desc: Interact with a beehive or beenest after pollinating to deposit the material and produce honey.
ht32.power.hive_protection.desc: As kin to the buzzing folk, you will always have the Protection of the Hive effect.
ht32.power.media_siphon.desc: You siphon xp to restore hunger, eating regular food will cause digestive issues. Amethyst items can be consumed to replenish xp.
ht32.power.pollinator.desc: Interact flower or crops with an empty hand to collect pollen and nectar. Might cause plant growth.
ht32.power.ruminate_xp.desc: You can burn experience to release media into the enviroment, and into your media holding items.
ht32.power.scrying_eyes.desc: Your vision is altered, as though you are wearing a scrying lens.
ht32.power.shock_absorb.desc: Fall and Impact damage is nullified.
ht32.power.swap_bodies.desc: Relocate your mind to another random body that you control.
ht32.power.swap_sickness.desc: The unanchored nature of your mind greatly reduces your health. Additionally, swapping between bodies briefly debuffs you.
ht32.power.unstable_vitality.desc: Taking damage may render the Reality Engine unstable. Should you fall below five hearts it is very likely you will suffer from unfortunate reality modifications.
ht32.power.vestigial.desc: Your axolotl half is forever fragile, reducing your max health by two hearts. Armor is reduced by 25% and you do not benefit from armor toughness.
ht32.power.wax_weaver.desc: As one with the hive and of beeish talents, you can craft some things others cannot.
ht32.power.weight_alter.desc: You can alter the amount of force gravity applies on you, allowing you to jump higher or fall faster.
